verses.roman:
āise yāya loka harṣe, nāhi samādhāna
lokera saṅghaṭṭe dina haila avasāna

synonyms: āise—come; yāya—go; loka—all people; harṣe—in great pleasure; nāhi—there is not; samādhāna—calculation; lokera—of the people; saṅghaṭṭe—in crowds; dina—the day; haila—there was; avasāna—the end.
translation: People came and went with great pleasure. There was no calculating how many people assembled there before the day was over.
